I wanted to know more about Ï€, but something's wrong.
c:
I thought that the sequence was wrong â€“ caused by an error. So I ran the code again.

I'd created the Daerryl algorithm, a code to generate the digits of Pi. It could generate billions of digits in the blink of an eye. I wanted to know Pi to its entirety since it defines everything, from the atoms to the universe.

But it happened again, the impossible error. After running for a few days, the code started generating only zeros. There were so many 0s that the code couldn't see the end of it.

I need to run the code again, I thought. And I did. Impossible! The 0s have moved.
I should check the code, I thought. But I knew very well that the code was correct.

A universal constant can't change, I kept thinking for the next few days as the code ran. This time the 0s have moved another hundred places closer. I ran the code again and the 0s have moved a thousand places.

It was getting closer, getting faster as time went. I felt the universe collapsing around me, the atoms collapsing inside me.
The 0s were heading for us, time seemed to speed up, but I felt slow. There were just zeros everywhere, null, void.

I wanted to know the end of Pi. I didn't want to wake something up. And now the void is coming to grasp us.





#code #constant #universe #atom #scifi #demons #end #infinite
